question.questionText: Explain why circuit 5 is a short circuit.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: the battery is contained in a path in which there is no bulb
The battery is contained in a path which does not contain any other components
The bulb is not in the closed path containing the battery
the battery is contained in a closed path in which there is no bulb
The battery is contained in a closed path which does not contain any other components

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: The battery is in a closed path. The battery is not connected to a bulb.
the battery is in a closed path
The battery is in a closed path alone.
The bulb is not contained in the circuit.
It is a short circuit because the battery is contained in a closed path without the bulb.
the battery is in a closed path without any other components
bulb is outside the closed path
The battery connects to a bulb.
Circuit 5 is a short circuit because it is contained in a closed path and the bulb does not interfere.
